fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Trade, Competition, Customs, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Business and Industry, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, External Relations, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Climate Action
eu_initiatives:
- A policy framework for climate and energy in the period from 2020 to 2030 (COM/2014/015) 
- Clean Energy Package COM (2016) 860  
- Strategy for reducing Heavy-Duty Vehicles' fuel consumption and CO2 emissions (COM/2014/285) 
- Horizon 2020 (COM/2011/0808) 
- A European Strategy for Low-Emission Mobility (COM/2016/501) 
- Clean Mobility Package (COM/2017/675)  
- Implementation of the Digital Single Market Strategy (COM/2017/228)  
- Report on the implementation of the Trade Strategy Trade for All (COM/2017/491)
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
Arconic is a member of the following EU associations: 
 
European Aluminium Association 
American Chamber of Commerce to the European Union 
BussinessEurope 
International Public Transport Association 
Association of European Wheel Manufacturers 
 
Arconic is also a member of the Public Affairs Council
goals__remit:
Arconic is a global technology, engineering and advanced manufacturing leader. 
Its European Government Relations Office in Brussels facilitates a continuous dialogue with EU decision-makers and other stakeholders and manages the company's membership in EU associations.
position: Director Government Affairs and Business Development
